links.title: Tomorrow May Bring More Pain For Stocks - Daily Commentary
links.description: For a minute it felt like the bulls were back. The NASDAQ even rallied about 1% at one point. But the rally fizzled by midday and by days end we finished right where we started, in the same precarious position we were in yesterday.

links.title: Analysts are missing the mark on shares of Apple and FANG, Cramer says
links.description: CNBC's Jim Cramer is tired of seeing negative Wall Street coverage suffocate the stocks of Apple and FANG, his acronym for Facebook, Amazon, Netflix and Google, now Alphabet. "Perhaps the most maligned" of them all is Apple, shares of which fell below their 200-day moving average on Tuesday as they dragged on the broader market, Cramer said on "Mad Money."

links.title: Don't fear the normal and routine
links.description: Free After-Hours Update: Tuesday was a back-and-forth session for the S&P 500 as early gains fizzled and we closed modestly in the red. The early strength ran into resistance near the 200dma as last week's relief turned into this week's second-guessing.
